document.docAuthor: Cidreira, Gabriel, Pinheiro-Junior, Eraldo P., Venekey, Virág & De Souza Alves, Orane F.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Pomponema Cobb, 1917 (Nematoda: Cyatholaimidae) from Northeast of Brazil, with reference to the taxonomic status of the genera Parapomponema Ott, 1972 and Propomponema Ott, 1972

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Pomponema Cobb, 1917 (Nematoda: Cyatholaimidae) from Northeast of Brazil, with reference to the taxonomic status of the genera Parapomponema Ott, 1972 and Propomponema Ott, 1972

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of
Pomponema Cobb, 1917

keyLead.keyStep:
1 Lateral differentiation of cuticle absent (or except tail region).................................................. 2 - Lateral differentiation of cuticle present................................................................... 6 2 Tail longer than 12 anal body diameters with 4/5 of the posterior portion filiform........
P. websteri Sharma & Vincx, 1982
- Tail shorter than 6 anal body diameters.................................................................... 3 3 Tail conical; 13 rectangular precloacal supplements.....................................
P. golikovi Platonova, 1988
- Tail conico-cylindrical................................................................................. 4 4 26 –29 precloacal supplements.........................................................
P. syltense Blome, 1974
- Less than 20 precloacal supplements...................................................................... 5 5 Inner labial setae 5–6 μm long; amphids diameter <50% of the corresponding body diameter......
P. foeticolum ( Ott, 1972 )
- Inner labial setae 1–5 μm long; amphids diameter> 60% of the corresponding body diameter.....
P. tautraense Allgén, 1933
6 Amphid located at apical surface of the head................................................................ 7 - Amphid posterior to midlevel of buccal cavity.............................................................. 9 7 Lateral differentiation of dots without transverse bars; 20 precloacal supplements..........
P. corniculata Gourbault, 1980
- Lateral differentiation of dots with transverse bars........................................................... 8 8 15 –19 complex precloacal supplements; tail 3.7–4.5 anal body diameters................
P. multipapillatum Filipjev, 1922
- 13–14 papillose precloacal supplements; tail 7.5–8.1 anal body diameters............
P. proximamphidum Tchesunov, 2008

paragraph.keyLead:
9 Lateral differentiation of dots irregular, not in longitudinal rows........................
P. ammophilum Lorenzen, 1972
- Lateral differentiation of dots in longitudinal rows.......................................................... 10
10 Lateral differentiation with three longitudinal rows of dots.................................................... 11
- Lateral differentiation with two or four longitudinal rows of dots............................................... 13

11 72 or more tubular precloacal supplements; tail with 1/3 of the posterior portion cylindrical............................................................................................
P. multisupplementa Huang & Zhang, 2014

12 11 precloacal supplements; tail with 2/3 of the posterior portion cylindrical..................
P. astrodes Lorenzen, 1972

- 2 preclocal supplements; spiral amphids with 5 1/3 turns...................................
P. coomansi Vincx, 1981
13 Lateral differentiation with two longitudinal rows of dots..................................................... 14
- Lateral differentiation with four or more longitudinal rows of dots.............................................. 23
17 Lateral differentiation of dots with transverse bars.......................................................... 18
- Lateral differentiation of dots without transverse bars........................................................ 19

18 Amphids with 3.5 turns; precloacal supplements complex....................................
P. sedecima Platt, 1973

- Amphids with 10 turns; precloacal supplements cup-shaped.................................
P. koesterae Jensen, 1992

19 Two rows of lateral dots originated in the base of neck; spicules slender; 20 precloacal supplements....................................................................................................
P. concinnum
wieser, 1954
- Two rows of lateral dots originated in the anterior region of neck............................................... 20

20 Length of inner labial setae almost equal to cephalic setae....................................
P. mirabile Cobb, 1917

22 Spicules 2 anal body diameters long....................................................
P. litorium ( Cobb, 1920 )

- Spicules 1 anal body diameter long...................................................
P. loticum Lorenzen, 1972

23 Without outer labial setae; 15 precloacal supplements..................................
P. cotylophorum Steiner, 1916
24 Only six outer labial setae; without four cephalic setae....................................................... 25
- Six outer labial setae and four cephalic setae in one circle.................................................... 28

27 12–15 precloacal supplements; tail longer than 125 μm...................................
P. elegans Lorenzen, 1972

- 15–18 precloacal supplements; tail shorter than 110 μm....................................
P. debile Lorenzen, 1972
28 Four cephalic setae equal to 50% of labial setae in length; more than 20 precloacal supplements...................... 29
- Four cephalic setae equal to 85% of labial setae in length; less than 15 precloacal supplements....................... 31

29 Four cephalic setae only 17% of labial setae in length; 23 precloacal supplements..............
P. stomachor
wieser, 1954
- Four cephalic setae longer than 40% of the six labial setae in length............................................ 30

30 Width of lateral differentiation equal to 60% of the corresponding body diameter; 20–22 precloacal supplements..................................................................................
P. clavicaudatum Stekhoven, 1935

- Width of lateral differentiation equal to 30% of the corresponding body diameter; 24 precloacal supplements............. P............................................................................. ..
polydontus Murphy, 1963

31 Labial setae almost equal to cephalic setae in length; 15 precloacal supplements.......
P. tesselatum
wieser & Hopper, 1967

- Labial setae shorter than 30% of cephalic setae in length; 1 precloacal supplement..............
P. lineatum Gerlach, 1953
